title: PC February 15 - Work training - Why is there the dominance of bourgeois ideology? - Steps from the 'What to do?' by Lenin
content:
We resume the following steps, which we will commemorate next Thursday

From the "What to do?": "But why the spontaneous movement ... goes towards The dominance of bourgeois ideology? For the simple reason that For its origin, bourgeois ideology is much older than the socialist one, it is more elaborate in all its aspects e It has incomparably larger means of diffusion ... "

Still, in a note: “It is often said the working class aspires spontaneously to socialism. This is very right in the sense that more deeply e more exactly than all the others the socialist theory determines the causes of the ailments of the working class and therefore the workers can assimilate it easily,so long asthis theory not chapters in front of spontaneity,so long aswe do not subject to the spontaneity, the working class aspires spontaneously to socialism but the bourgeois ideology that is the most widespread (and that constantly It rises in the most varied forms), however, it is imposed spontaneously more than any other at the worker.

Referring to Journal of Economism, Rabociaja Myisl Lenin writes: “Don't denial completely the political struggle ... speaks of the fight against the government ... He just thinks that politics always follows

the economy ... these thesis are absolutely false,If by politics we mean the social democratic policy(Communist editor's note). The economic struggle of the workers, as we have seen, is very often linked (although not inextricably) to bourgeois politics ... politics tradunionist is the general aspiration of all workers ad obtain direct measures against the ailments proper to the state of the their condition, but not yet suitable to suppress this condition, that is, to destroy the submission of work to capital ... So, there is politics and political ... ".

Economists “By fully recognizing the growing political struggle spontaneously from the same worker movement (or rather the claims and political aspirations of the workers) ... refuse Absolutely to independently elaborate a policy ... specifies who responds to the tasks of socialism and current conditions ", of the country and the class struggle.

Lenin continuing In the examination of other forms of economism, he takes in consideration those who give much weight to the spontaneous struggle of workers, who of course when he begins to wake up grabs the first means of struggle that happen, but clearly these first means They will be the tradunionists and the first ideology that happens will be Always bourgeois ideology ".

Lenin does not put in discussion this process nor “that the mass worker movement It is a very important phenomenon is something on which there is no discussion. But the question lies in the way of understanding how this movementIt will determine the tasks.There What can be understood in two ways, or in the sense of the cult of the spontaneity of this movement, that is, the reduction of the role of social democracy to pure servility towards the worker movement as such ...,orin the sense that the mass movement places usnewassignments Theoretical, political, organizational much more complex ... ".

Lenin continues examining how economists, even when they do right political statements, always translate them into forms of adaptation to the existing movement; and contrasts with them The organization for political struggle. And takes into consideration Some aspects of this position of economists.

In A note is written: “The theory of stadiums, or shy theory Zig-Zag, it is expressed as follows: common political claims ... However, they must correspond in the early days to the experience that a determined layer of workers has obtained from the economic struggle. Only on the ground of this experience can it be and must undertake political agitation ".

AND To strengthen this concept, economists argue: “Which Social Democrat does not know that according to Marx and Engels' doctrine The economic interests of the individual classes perform a function decisive in history and that,consequently, In particular, the struggle of the proletariat for his interests economic must have a primary meaning for its development of class and the emancipator struggle? ".

Lenin Reply: “This is consequently absolutely inappropriate. From the the fact that economic interests perform a decisive function notderives at allno consequence on the primary meaning of the economic struggle (= union), because the most essential "decisive" interests classes can be satisfiedonlywith radical transformationspoliciesin general; in particular, the fundamental economic interest of proletariat can only be satisfied through a revolution policy that replaces the dictatorship of the bourgeoisie of the proletariat ".
